channel.title: Help?
channel.description:
hey guys i'm sorry bout this... i'm new to rsps but i'm getting the hang of the coding pretty easy...
i got a nice source etc but it's max cash is 999999999 :(
does anyone know where the code is thats says what the limit is on cash? eg. class?? or client?? i've looked in so many places but i just can't find it!
As well as this i am having problems with compiler... it was fine until i was adding things, it lasted a while and now when i compile i have erros about debugging and i haven't changed that part... This is a big problem because i can't edit/add any more to the server... its not changing anything in-game! eg i had sm welcome to kbd dungeon and now i changed that but in-game it hasn't whereas in client it has :confused:
Also can anyone add me on msn to help? i need a tester i can't have server online though because before when i did it lagged to bad so i'm looking more into this part but i'm happy to try and send someone the files etc...
msn: benjig100@msn.com
The tester(s) will be given place(s) as admin(s) or maybe co-owner(s) once the server is up and running... :)
[b]thnx to anyone that can help and happy codeing guys :D[/b]
[i]sorry to any mods if this is in the wrong place... i couldn't find where to put it :|[/i]

item.title: Help?
item.dc:creator: @05bgoodson 05bgoodson
item.description:
@05bgoodson wrote:

lol or it is because the server can no longer debug

Read full topic

item.title: Help?
item.dc:creator: @durial12 durial12
item.description:
@durial12 wrote:

If you get 100 errors, its because you have put { and } in the wrong places/ not enough.

Read full topic

item.title: Help?
item.dc:creator: @05bgoodson 05bgoodson
item.description:
@05bgoodson wrote:

well… lol the lines above are irelivant because it just has
/////////////////////////////////////////////////

and once i deleted the top { i got spammed from compiler

^ client.java:10794: class, interface, or enum expected public void declineTrade() { ^ client.java:10798: class, interface, or enum expected } else ^ client.java:10801: class, interface, or enum expected AntiDupe = 2; i < item.amount; i++) { ^ client.java:10818: class, interface, or enum expected for (int i = 0; i < item.amount; i++) { ^ client.java:10820: class, interface, or enum expected } ^ client.java:10824: class, interface, or enum expected tradeConfirmed = false; ^ client.java:10825: class, interface, or enum expected tradeConfirmed2 = false; ^ client.java:10826: class, interface, or enum expected offeredItems.clear(); ^ client.java:10827: class, interface, or enum expected inTrade = false; ^ client.java:10828: class, interface, or enum expected trade_reqId = 0; ^ client.java:10829: class, interface, or enum expected } ^ client.java:10831: class, interface, or enum expected public boolean DeleteArrow() { ^ client.java:10834: class, interface, or enum expected return false; ^ client.java:10835: class, interface, or enum expected } ^ client.java:10839: class, interface, or enum expected outStream.writeWord(1688); ^ client.java:10840: class, interface, or enum expected outStream.writeByte(playerArrows); ^ client.java:10841: class, interface, or enum expected outStream.writeWord(playerEquipment[playerArrow ^ client.java:10842: class, interface, or enum expected if (playerEquipmentN[playerArrows] - 1 > 254) { ^ client.java:10844: class, interface, or enum expected outStream.writeDWord(playerEquipmentN[p ws] - 1); ^ client.java:10864: class, interface, or enum expected outStream.writeWord(playerEquipment[playerWeapo ^ client.java:10865: class, interface, or enum expected if (playerEquipmentN[playerWeapon] - 1 > 254) { ^ client.java:10867: class, interface, or enum expected outStream.writeDWord(playerEquipmentN[p on] - 1); ^ client.java:10881: class, interface, or enum expected outStream.createFrame(34); ^ client.java:10882: class, interface, or enum expected outStream.writeWord(6); ^ client.java:10883: class, interface, or enum expected outStream.writeWord(1688); ^ client.java:10884: class, interface, or enum expected outStream.writeByte(slot); ^ client.java:10885: class, interface, or enum expected outStream.writeWord(0); ^ client.java:10886: class, interface, or enum expected outStream.writeByte(0); ^ client.java:10887: class, interface, or enum expected ResetBonus(); ^ client.java:10888: class, interface, or enum expected GetBonus(); ^ client.java:10889: class, interface, or enum expected WriteBonus(); ^ client.java:10890: class, interface, or enum expected updateRequired = true; ^ client.java:10891: class, interface, or enum expected appearanceUpdateRequired = true; ^ client.java:10892: class, interface, or enum expected } ^ client.java:10894: class, interface, or enum expected public void deleteItem(int id, int amount) { ^ client.java:10896: class, interface, or enum expected } ^ client.java:10898: class, interface, or enum expected public void deleteItem(int id, int slot, int amount) { ^ client.java:10903: class, interface, or enum expected } else { ^ client.java:10905: class, interface, or enum expected playerItems[slot] = 0; ^ client.java:10906: class, interface, or enum expected } ^ client.java:10908: class, interface, or enum expected } ^ client.java:10913: class, interface, or enum expected public void destruct() { ^ client.java:10924: class, interface, or enum expected } // already shutdown ^ client.java:10928: class, interface, or enum expected disconnected = true; ^ client.java:10929: class, interface, or enum expected if (saveNeeded) ^ client.java:10931: class, interface, or enum expected if (in != null) { ^ client.java:10933: class, interface, or enum expected } ^ client.java:10936: class, interface, or enum expected } ^ client.java:10938: class, interface, or enum expected mySock = null; ^ client.java:10939: class, interface, or enum expected in = null; ^ client.java:10940: class, interface, or enum expected out = null; ^ client.java:10941: class, interface, or enum expected inStream = null; ^ client.java:10942: class, interface, or enum expected outStream = null; ^ client.java:10943: class, interface, or enum expected isActive = false; ^ client.java:10944: class, interface, or enum expected synchronized (this) { ^ client.java:10946: class, interface, or enum expected } // make sure this threads gets control so it nate ^ client.java:10948: class, interface, or enum expected } catch (java.io.IOException ioe) { ^ client.java:10950: class, interface, or enum expected } ^ client.java:10952: class, interface, or enum expected } ^ client.java:10980: class, interface, or enum expected outStream.currentOffset = 0; // reset ^ client.java:10981: class, interface, or enum expected } ^ client.java:10983: class, interface, or enum expected public int distanceToPoint(int pointX, int pointY) { ^ client.java:10986: class, interface, or enum expected } ^ client.java:10987: class, interface, or enum expected public void dropItem(int droppedItem, int slot) { ^ client.java:10992: class, interface, or enum expected if(playerName == null) ^ client.java:10994: class, interface, or enum expected if(droppedItem == 4708){ ^ client.java:10996: class, interface, or enum expected } ^ client.java:10999: class, interface, or enum expected } ^ client.java:11002: class, interface, or enum expected } ^ 100 errors

you probably don’t need to read it all to understand that that its because now the debugging has stopped working, well thats my guess

i think the main point is that it worked before i added some commands, and because of this error will this explain why when i add new command now or change existing one it keeps the command before i changed in-game??

this is a rather annoying error now lol[br][br][size=1]Posted on: November 07, 2009, 04:40:24 am[/size][hr]guys i got some more information that might help, ok i got a brand new source of my server and i began copying in 1 command at a time (that being all i had added) thn i got same compiler error, does this mean it will be the server disliking one of my commands?[br][br][size=1]Posted on: November 07, 2009, 04:42:20 am[/size][hr]ok now after testing abit more i’ve relised i had a syntax error with the command but why would this effect the debug?

Read full topic

item.title: Help?
item.dc:creator: @05bgoodson 05bgoodson
item.description:
@05bgoodson wrote:

thnx alot for the help guys and about the compiler error it changes i change what it suggests to what it tells me to and then it comes up with other errors

here is this part of code coming up with all errors although i haven’t changed it

public void debug(String text) { if (debug) sM(text); } public void declineTrade() { if (!hasAccepted && AntiDupe <= 0) { declineTrade(true); } else { hasAccepted = false; AntiDupe = 2; } }

Compiler error now is

client.java:10790: illegal start of expression public void debug(String text) { ^ 1 error

if anyone can help??

and by the way i know that the code is probably wrong but thats what compiler suggested!

thnx if you can help me

Read full topic

item.title: Help?
item.dc:creator: @ollie123 Ollie123
item.description:
@ollie123 wrote:

[quote=“jamessemple, post:3, topic:312455”]it’s in player.java
(you can only input 2147000000 or around that for max cash because if you try doing 2148m or higher java will complain the number is too large :p)[/quote]

2147483647 to be precise

Read full topic

item.title: Help?
item.dc:creator: @jamessemple jamessemple
item.description:
@jamessemple wrote:

it’s in player.java
(you can only input 2147000000 or around that for max cash because if you try doing 2148m or higher java will complain the number is too large :p)
